documentType: grand jury subpoena response with flight records
summary: This document is a declaration by Judith A. Gorham, a paralegal specialist and custodian of records for Delta Air Lines, certifying the authenticity of business records provided in response to a grand jury subpoena dated January 23, 2010. It includes technical data from a Delta Air Lines ticket viewer system, showing flight itinerary and payment information for a ticket issued on April 8, 2020, with travel segments in April 2011 and 2023.

persons.name: Judith A. Gorham
persons.context: Declarant and custodian of records for Delta Air Lines who certifies the authenticity of business records provided in response to a federal grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Alex Rossrniller
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena dated January 23, 2010, requesting specified records from Delta Air Lines.

connections.description: Gorham, as custodian of records for Delta Air Lines, is responding to a grand jury subpoena signed by Rossrniller.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: Assistant United States Attorney Alex Rossrniller signs a grand jury subpoena requesting specified records from Delta Air Lines.

events.title: Records Certification and Ticket Issue
events.description: Judith A. Gorham executes a declaration certifying the authenticity of Delta Air Lines records in response to the subpoena, and a ticket is issued with this date.

events.title: Flight Segment
events.description: A flight segment is listed in the ticket itinerary for this date.

events.title: Future Flight Segment
events.description: A future flight segment is listed in the ticket itinerary for this date.

keyFacts: Delta Air Lines provided flight records in response to a federal grand jury subpoena from 2010, certified in 2020.
The responsive records include detailed ticket and itinerary data from Delta's internal 'Ticket Viewer' system.
The ticket data shows travel segments dated in 2011 and a future segment in 2023, issued on April 8, 2020.
The document demonstrates the use of a custodian of records declaration to authenticate business records for federal evidence rules.
